div.p: We have measured the x-ray absorption-fine-structure (EXAFS) at the Y-K edge of YBa2Cu30x for x=6. 806, 6.886, 6.947, 6.986, 6.984 at T=20-300 K. Optimum doping is found to be a notable point in the x-T phase diagram, also concerning the c-axis related displacements of the planar 02,3 and Cu2 atoms. The 02,3-Cu2 spacing along c is found to be largest at xopt. In the underdoped regime doping reduces the Cu2-02,3 spacing by displacing the 02,3 layer towards the Cu2 layer. In the overdoped regime doping reduces the Cu2-02,3 spacing by displacing the 02,3 layer towards the Cu2 layer [1,2]. Further we wish to emphazise the following details of the local structure and its vibrational dynamics:

1.) The Y-012 bondlengths are independent on doping. In the normal phase the Y-Cu2 pairs vibrate harmonically, but in the superconducting phase the Y-Cu2 vibrations freeze out. On doping the Cu2 atoms shift along the c directions towards the Ba layer.

2.) The Y-02,3 pairs exhibit strong anharmonicities. The degree of non-Gaussian disorder and the strong anharmonic vibrational dynamics depend significantly on the oxygen concentration. The Y-02,3 mean squared deviations do not freeze out in the superconducting phase as the Y-Cu2 vibrations. But the mean-cubic deviations of the Y-CuZ-Ba ("6.2") multiple scattering peaks, which yield the 023 Cu2 spacing of the dimpled CuO2 planes. Right: The peak heights "6.2" and "5" monitor the c-axis related displacements of the Cu2 and 023 layers, respectively. Its ratio clearly exhibits the 02,3Cu2 spacing to be largest at optimum doping.

figure.head: Fig 1 .
